dataset.description: This dataset is about ICE/HSI numerous efforts and operations which were developed and implemented strategies for combating Illicit Opioids,. This also builds upon many of the ICE's directorate’s core investigative authorities and capabilities in fighting Transnational Criminal Organizations(TCOs) and aligns with the National Drug Control Strategy. Throughout the year, HSI participated in and led numerous operations to help protect the United States from the scourge of fentanyl and fentanyl-related substances. From March through May 2023, HSI partnered with U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) to lead Operation Blue Lotus, a surge in fentanyl interdictions that resulted in the seizure of over 8,200 pounds of fentanyl and 284 arrests.
dataset.title: Combatting Illicit Fentanyl

dataset.description: This dataset is building on the success of Blue Lotus, DHS launched a second phase between June and July 2023 named Operation Blue Lotus 2.0. The second phase concurrently targeted the fentanyl distribution of fentanyl-related substance networks along the Southwest Border and the interior of the United States by surging HSI personnel to strengthen local field office interdiction, enforcement, and investigative efforts. Operations focused on national initiatives to include major international commercial express consignment centers that target the smuggling of illicit narcotics and chemicals into the United States. In FY 2023, Operation Blue Lotus 2.0 resulted in the seizure of over 2,880 pounds of fentanyl and fentanyl-related substances; over 36,600 pounds of other narcotics including methamphetamine, cocaine, and heroin; and 326 criminal arrests.
dataset.title: Blue Lotus2.0

dataset.description: In August 2023, ICE/HSI’s counter-fentanyl and counter-fentanyl-related substance operations transitioned from Southwest Border surge efforts to a nationwide, counter-opioid initiative known as Operation Opioid Response and Investigation of Networks (ORION). Operation ORION aligns with the goals and strategies set forth in the Strategy for Combating Illicit Opioids, allowing HSI to leverage its vast administrative, civil, and criminal law enforcement authorities to counter fentanyl and fentanyl-related substance distribution. Under the operation, HSI continued to increase the number of Border Enforcement Security Task Forces (BESTs), Fentanyl Abatement and Suppression Teams, and Fentanyl Overdose Resolution Teams in strategic locations to support HSI’s nationwide fentanyl and fentanyl-related substance supply reduction strategy. This increase will simultaneously be reflected in HSI and CBP joint operations at and along the Southwest Border.
dataset.title: Operation Orion

dataset.description: Dataset is about Operation Chain Breaker (OCB) which is an initiative targeting Chinese pill press manufacturers and the Mexican Transnational Crime Organizations (TCOs) using pill press equipment to mass produce fentanyl pills being smuggled into the United States. OCB is one of three nationally branded DHS/HSI National Opioid Strategy Initiatives, which is focused on Chinese pill press supply chains; Mexican pill press brokers; Mexican TCOs using pill press equipment to mass produce fentanyl and fentanyl-related substances; domestic pill press equipment recipients engaged in fentanyl and fentanyl-related substance production; and money launderers facilitating the movement of fentanyl proceeds.
dataset.title: Operation Chain Breaker

dataset.description: Dataset is about the HSI Operation Popeye which was conducted in collaboration with partners in Italy, Colombia, and the United States to dismantle multiple organized crime groups operating in domestically and in Europe, while simultaneously disrupting a Colombian drug cartel representing one of the largest suppliers of cocaine and fentanyl to Europe and North America. Operation Popeye led to the seizure of 4.4 tons of cocaine, 66 kilograms of heroin, €1.85 million (approximately $2.04 million), and 63 arrests. This investigation leveraged HSI’s unique domestic and international authorities and resources to coordinate one of the largest and most complex undercover operations ever accomplished through United States and international law enforcement partnerships.
dataset.title: Dismantling Organized Crime

dataset.description: This is a database system which has previously been accredited under the I2F accredidation and is now being accredited on its own. This PTA is for the Oracle COTs product on its own, without the inclusion of any data. Systems that will store data within this system will be required separately to submit a PTA and PIA if required.
dataset.title: Oracle  RAC

dataset.description: Preliminary Damage Assessment (PDA) Public Assistance (PA) Dataset (Unstructured entry) is a collection of information about damages to public facilities and infrastructure. Some of the fields include location information, cause of damage, cost information, and category of work the damaged facility, as outlined in the 2021 FEMA Preliminary Damage Assessment (PDA) Guide. Additional fields are requested for each category of work identified. This includes debris locations and types (Category A), emergency activities required to respond to the incident and the resulting impacts to the communities (Category B), and permanent repair work information (Categories C through G) such as facility types, necessary repairs, and special consideration information such as age of the facility, ground disturbing activities required for repairs, and repairs needed near water.
dataset.title: Preliminary Damage Assessment (PDA) Public Assistance (PA) Dataset

dataset.description: Advanced Shipment Notifications (ASNs) represent movements of commodities from one location to another and are associated with orders. Advanced Shipment Notifications (ASNs) are interfaced between the Combined Application and Warehouse Management (WM) depending on the origin/destination facilities.
dataset.title: Advanced Shipment Notification (ASN)

dataset.description: A carrier is the company or entity contracted by FEMA to moves goods from one location to another.  Carriers are assigned to shipments of commodities from one location to another.  Only one carrier can be assigned to a shipment.  Carrier information includes carrier name, carrier indentifier code, contact details, equipment list, transportation mode, and operating hours.
dataset.title: Carrier Company

dataset.description: Customer Orders (COs) are placed in the Combined Application to request commodities/assets be sent to a destination facility and also to request the retrograde of commodities/assets no longer needed.
dataset.title: Customer Order (CO)

dataset.description: Distribution Orders (DOs) are created in the Combined Application to direct the movement of commodities/assets from one facility to another facility. Certain types of Distribution Orders (DOs) are related to Customer Orders (COs). Distribution Orders (DOs) that have an Origin Facility where Facility Type = “Warehouse” are interfaced into Warehouse Management (WM).
dataset.title: Distribution Order (DO)

dataset.description: A physical location in the supply chain that receives, stocks, and ships resources. A facility can be a FEMA location such as a Distribution Center, FEMA Staging Area, or a Field office.  Additionally, a facility can be a parter location such as a State Staging Area or a Point of Distribution where commodities are made available to the public.
dataset.title: Facility Location

dataset.description: Government barcodes provide serial number tracking of certain assets and can be associated with an incoming License Plate Number (iLPN) or an outgoing License Plate Number (oLPN). In Warehouse Management (WM), Government Barcodes are stored in the License Plate Number (LPN) Serial Number field.
dataset.title: Asset (Barcode Item)

dataset.description: Items, also referred to as Stock Keeping Units (SKUs), are categories of like resources that are stocked in the warehouse. All resources grouped as an item share key attributes, and are either identical or treated identically during the fulfillment process.
dataset.title: Item (Resource Inventory)

dataset.description: Item Inventory represents the aggregate quantity of units of an item per facility in the system.  Each location can store many items such as drinking water, tarps, meals, or generators.  The Item Inventory refers to the quantitiy available at the facility.  For example, a FEMA Staging Area could have 5,000 bottles of drinking water.
dataset.title: Item Inventory

dataset.description: License Plate Numbers (LPNs) represent inventory within FEMA DCs that utilize Warehouse Management (WM). Typically, a License Plate Number (LPN) represents a single container of inventory – typically a pallet of items, but could also refer to a single asset, such as a generator, that is stored and moved by unit.  LPNs can be incoming to a facility (iLPN) (or stored at a facility), or outgoing from a facility (oLPN).
dataset.title: License Plate Number (LPN)

dataset.description: Pre-staged trailers represent trailers or shipping containers full of unallocated, unshipped pallets that are stored in anticipation of a future response. Pre-Staged Trailers are not maintained within their own tables in Warehouse Management (WM). Instead, Pre-Staged Trailer attributes are derived from data within the License Plate Number (LPN) object.
dataset.title: Pre-Staged Trailer

dataset.description: Shipments within LSCMS-C represent a movement of commodities from one facility to another facility.  A shipment can include different items.  Only one carrier can be assigned to a shipment.
dataset.title: Shipment (Delivery)

dataset.description: Trailers are tracked by status, ownership, and location.  Specific characteristics include height, weight, configuration, certification, and capacity.  Equipment codes are created and maintained in the user interface equipment setup.
dataset.title: Trailer (Box, Chassis, or Flat Bed)

dataset.description: Agreements between federal agencies, Components, state and local governments, tribal and non-governmental organizations. The Agreements delineate tasks, jurisdiction, standard operating procedures or other matters which the parties are duly authorized and directed to conduct. Documents include, but not are not limited to, official signed copies of the agreements/understanding, including formalized performance criteria for quality of service, definition of responsibilities, response times and volumes, charging, integrity guarantees, and non-disclosure agreements, reproduced copies thereof, amendments thereto, extensions thereto, applications for interoperability, evaluations of interoperability, continued conformance with requirements, and all related correspondence and other materials.
dataset.title: Inter-Agency Agreements and Intra-Agency Agreements

dataset.description: Agreements with the international community and foreign countries, under which the Department provides or receives technologies, services, or data. Documents include the agreements and understandings, amendments, all communication and activities related to the agreements and understandings, and all related correspondence and other materials. This refers to the amendments, communication and activities related to the agreements and understandings.
dataset.title: International Agreements - Agreements and understandings, amendments, all communication and activities related to the agreements and understandings

dataset.description: Agreements with the international community and foreign countries, under which the Department provides or receives technologies, services, or data. Documents include the agreements and understandings, amendments, all communication and activities related to the agreements and understandings, and all related correspondence and other materials. This refers to the background materials, routine correspondence and administrative materials related to the agreements and understandings.
dataset.title: International Agreements - All related background materials, routine correspondence and associated administrative materials.

dataset.description: Include request forms, copies of email messages, source documents, and responses indicating outcome of request Declassification requests are received electronically or hard copy and are authorized by the originating law enforcement agency.
dataset.title: Declassification Request Files

dataset.description: Dissemination files contain finished and current intelligence report information distributed to support the Intelligence Community, DHS Components and Federal, State, Local, Tribal and Foreign Governments. Dissemination lists contain contact information for the distribution of finished and current intelligence reports.
dataset.title: Dissemination Files and Lists

dataset.description: Include information Reports that contain raw, unevaluated intelligence on threat reporting originating from operational data (such as Homeland Intelligence Reports) and supporting documentation distributed via email and/or web based posting to support the Intelligence Community, DHS Components, the Private Sector and Federal, State, Local, Tribal and Foreign Governments.
dataset.title: Raw Reporting Files

dataset.description: Include, but is not limited to, finished intelligence and associated background material for products such as Warning Products identifying imminent homeland security threats, assessments providing intelligence analysis on specific topics, Executive Products providing intelligence reporting to DHS senior leadership, Intelligence Summaries about current intelligence events, and Periodic Reports containing intelligence awareness information for a specific region, sector, or area of interest.
dataset.title: Finished Intelligence Case Files

dataset.description: Requests for information routinely received from DHS Components, the Private Sector, and Federal, State, and Local law enforcement agencies. Requests and responses are assigned an RFI number and catalogued for tracking purposes. Requests, research, responses and supporting documentation are maintained and disseminated electronically and additionally printed to hard copy and filed by FY and RFI number. Includes RFI data in any electronic information system (e.g. Pantheon).
dataset.title: Requests for Information (RFI)/Data Calls

dataset.description: Data stored in the 24 Hour Log is received from the Intelligence Community (IC) via incoming record message traffic; classified and unclassified email; reports submitted via internal channels from DHS law enforcement components; reports (email, telephone, or facsimile) from Homeland Security mission partners (Federal, state, local, tribal, and industry) and reports broadcast by news media.
dataset.title: IWW 24 Hour Log-Input Records

dataset.description: The 24-Hour Log data can only be retained if the data is relevant to the Homeland Security mission and can be legally retained under Intelligence Oversight regulations. rnrnThe information entered into the log is dependent upon the content of the source report used to generate the log entry. The information for each incident varies depending upon the incident and circumstances surrounding the collection of information about the incident. rnrnInformation may be collected about the person who reported the incident and people involved in a reported incident, which may turn up varying levels of personal information, most often name and citizenship. Additional personal information may be collected and may include, but is not limited to, Social Security Number, passport or driver's license numbers or other identifying information; location of residency, names of associates, political or religious aff1hat1ons or membership m some group or organization, and other information deemed important by the reporting official.
dataset.title: IWW 24 Hour Log-Master File/Data (24 Hour Log Data)

dataset.description: The 24-Hour Log is setup to alert management of records that will be due for review prior to the expiration date. At that time (or any time beforehand) a record can be reviewed and certified by the analyst that there is still a mission need to retain the information. The expiration date will then be set for an additional year out This can go on for as long as the information is deemed necessary for the mission. If a record arrives at its expiration date without being reviewed and approved, the record will automatically be purged from the system.
dataset.title: IWW 24 Hour Log-Master File/Data (Categorized Records)

dataset.description: This same functionality exists for the uncategorized records, however with the 180-day deadline as opposed to the 1-year timeframe. If a category is determined for such a record, an update can be made, and the record will then be set with a 1-year out expiration date.
dataset.title: IWW 24 Hour Log-Master File/Data (Uncategorized Records)

dataset.description: The Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) categories are designed to protect sensitive information that is not classified but still requires safeguarding. These categories are organized into groups by the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) to facilitate efficient management and protection.

publisher.name: FEMA/Off of Policy & Pgm Analysis/ENTERPRISE ANALYTICS DIV

dataset.title: Reference Data CUI Categories

dataset.description: The Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA) Tribal Directory.  The Bureau of Indian Affairs (BIA) first developed the Tribal Leaders Directory as an internal reference document for its employees. The Directory is not an official listing of federally recognized tribes. It should be used in conjunction with the Federal Register Notice of Indian Entities Recognized and Eligible to Receive Services from the United States Bureau of Indian Affairs (81 Fed. Reg. 26826), which is the official listing of all federally recognized tribes in the United States, pursuant to the Federally Recognized Indian Tribe List Act of 1994 (Pub. L. 103-454, 108 Stat. 4791-4792).

publisher.name: FEMA/Off of Policy & Pgm Analysis/ENTERPRISE ANALYTICS DIV

dataset.title: Reference Data Tribal Directory

dataset.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Intelligence and Analysis (I&A) Open Source Enterprise (OSE) is an intelligence collection program within DHS I&A that collects information, through publicly available sources, and reports that information in support of Departmental missions. The collection and reporting by the DHS I&A OSE addresses statutory and other federal legal requirements for the Undersecretary of Intelligence and Analysis relating to the collection and usage of publicly available information. In the execution of this intelligence mission, Personally Identifiable Information (PII) may be collected and reported.
dataset.title: 010 Office of Intelligence and Analysis Open Source Enterprice Open Source Intelligence Collection and Reporting

dataset.description: Descriptions of all National Disaster & Emergency Management University (NDEMU) Independent Study courses including code, title, date, overview, prerequisities, CEUs, and length.
dataset.title: NDEMU Independent Study Course Information

dataset.description: Tableau is a cloud-enabled, Business Intelligence platform to support HR analysis, ad hoc reporting, custom reports and dashboards, providing strategic and analytical awareness through OCHCO Data. Tableau pulls data from different data sources and the results are shared with our customers and partners for data driven decision making.
dataset.title: Tableau Data Visualization for OCHCO Data

dataset.description: Export of Content Completions from Acadis API. Training completion data reporting.
dataset.title: Acadis Training Records

dataset.description: EIE interface with DHS Trusted Identity Exchange. TIE is DHS privacy enhancing service that process identity, credential and access management data for employees and contractors.  API is used to process OCHCO onboard/offboard data with TIE ISMS and ALMS as consuming applications.
dataset.title: OCHCO EIE TIE

dataset.description: GovTa is a Time & Attendance system from USDA NFC. GovTA is the next iteration of the USDA NFC’s time and attendance system, replacing webTA. GovTA is a web-based system that is used to submit work time and leave information to the Department’s payroll/personnel service provider, the National Finance Center (NFC), for salary payment. Employees use this system to enter their own biweekly time and leave data, request leave, and validate the data online.
dataset.title: USDA NFC GovTa Time & Attendance System

dataset.description: Integrated Security Management System (ISMS) provides security clearance, suitability determinations and background investigations information to OCHCO via Trusted Identity Exchange (TIE).
dataset.title: OCHCO TIE ISMS

dataset.description: This dataset describes information regarding M&A's mission and their main areas of focus.
dataset.title: M&A Mission and Orgaization

dataset.description: This dataset provides information and data about ERO's limited resources and their increased mission demands. In order to meet their gorwing mission demands, ERO has had to prioritize certain areas of its mission and finding ways to be more efficient whenever possible.
dataset.title: Balancing Resources to Support Increased Mission Demands

dataset.description: This dataset provides information about ERO's commitment to recruiting, hiring, and retention of its workforce.
dataset.title: ERO Recruiting, Hiring, and Retention

dataset.description: This dataset provides details about how ERO is improving the agency's operational efficiency. ERO launced the ICE Portal, a public-facing website that centralizes communications between non-detained noncitizens and the federal government. This allows non-citizens to do certain tasks, such as scheduling appointments and updating their address. In addition, ERO is testing the ICE Check-In App in its Miami field office, which allows a limited number of low-risk noncitizens on the non-detained docket to conduct their mandatory check-ins with ERO officers remotely. This app uses multiple verication tools, such as facial verification and geolocation to verify users and allows ICE to optimize scarce resources versus in-person reporting processes. Additionally, ERO laucned the ERO eFile system across the country to allow legal representatives to more easily file their Form G-28 Notice of Entry of Appearance as Attorney or Accredited Representative. This system enables the agency to more efficiently report on representation rates and automates representative information. ERO has also began development on an online scheduling tool for legal visits at ICE detention facilities through ERO eFile, which will reduce administrative burdenof continuously vetting elgal representatives and scheduling legal visits
dataset.title: Increasing Operational Efficiency

dataset.description: This dataset provides details about the Guidelines for the Enforcement of Civil Immigration Law memorandum that DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas issued on September 30, 2021, which instructs DHS immigration officers to prioritize apprehending and removing noncitizens considered to be threats to national security, public safety and border security. This dataset also details ICE reinstituting the application of the civil immigration and enforcement priorities (CIEP) memorandum and CIEP Arrest and detainer data.
dataset.title: DHS Enforcement Prioritites

dataset.description: This dataset contains information about ERO civil immigration detention and contains information about the three categories that noncitizens in ICE detention generally falls into. This dataset also includes data about removal orders, number of noncitizens detained by country of citizenship, by arresting agency, average daily population, and average length of stay by arresting agency.
dataset.title: Detained Docket Population

dataset.description: This data set is about how ICE detains noncitizens as necessary. Most noncitizens subject to removal are monitored outside the detention setting through a variety of mechanisms. Cases on the non-detained national docket are either categorized as “Final Order,” meaning the noncitizen has completed the legal process and has been ordered removed, or “Pending Final Order,” indicating that an order of removal has not yet been issued or is not administratively final.
dataset.title: Non-Detained Docket Population

dataset.description: This dataset contains information on the count of Alternatives to Detention (ATD) cases based on an average day in FY 2024.
dataset.title: Alternatives to Detention

dataset.description: This dataset include information about how ERO uses technology to monitor noncitizens on the ATD-Intensive Supervision Appearance Program (ISAP). ERO uses technologies such as telephonic reporting, GPS monitoring and biometric facial comparison. Counts of participants on ATD-ISAP are included in this dataset.
dataset.title: ATD - Intensive Supervision Appearance Program

dataset.description: This dataset contains information on the count of participants in the Young Adult Case Management Program (YACMP).
dataset.title: Young Adult Case Management Program

dataset.description: This dataset includes information about HSI's crucial role in several significant, high-profile investigations that enhanced national security and public safety.
dataset.title: HSI Operational Components

dataset.description: This dataset includes count of HSI's field offices, Special Agent in Charge (SAC)  offices, number of special agents and additional personnel across the United States.
dataset.title: HSI Domestic Operations and Footprint

dataset.description: This dataset includes information about HSI's international operations and counts of  the countries HSI has offices in, personnel, and involvemetn in international task forces.
dataset.title: HSI International Operations and Footprint

dataset.description: This dataset details the HSI Strategic Network Distmantlement Project (HSNDP), which aims to combat and disrupt transnational criminal networks (TCNs) that pose the greatest threats to the security of the US.
dataset.title: HSI Strategic Network Dismantlement Project

dataset.description: This dataset details the HSI NAATL, which is a centralized hub dedicated to advanced programmtic training and leadership development opportunities for all HSI employees.
dataset.title: HSI National Academy for Advanced Training and Leadership

dataset.description: This dataset contains information about HSI's pivitol role in Know2Protect (K2P) campaign, which aims to prevent and combat online child sexual exploitation and abuse. K2P has made substatial progress in raising awareness and equippiung adults and children with vital tools to safeguard against online dangers, mainly through its digital strategy, which had over 78 million impressions through sevel new videos and targetd digital advertising
dataset.title: Know2Protect Campaign and Project iGuardian

dataset.description: This datset details the HSI El Dorado Task Force (EDTF) to disrupt and dismantle transnational money laundering organizations operating in the United States. The EDTF National Initiative builds on the successes of the original HSI New York EDTF and brings together the collective anti-money laundering (AML) expertise of its stakeholders and personnel. Since launching the EDTF National Initiative in FY 2024, 28 of HSI's 30 Special Agent in Charge field offices have established operational EDTFs.
dataset.title: Expansion of El Dorado Task Force

dataset.description: This datset contains information about HSI's standalone branding initiative, which include the hsi.gov email and internet domain, branding, and more.
dataset.title: HSI Branding

dataset.description: This dataset includes infomration about HSI's Direct-Hire Authority to address critical hiring needs. The DHA allows HSI to reach applicants who otherwise may not have considered a law enforcement career.
dataset.title: Direct-Hire Authority for Recruitment

dataset.description: This dataset includes details about the awards that HSI received from the Office of National Drug Control Policy. In FY 2024, HSI received awards in three of nine ONDCP award categories.
dataset.title: White House Office of National Drug Crontol Policy Awards

dataset.description: This dataset includes information about HSI expanding its Congressional Engagement Program. In FY 2024, this program led the introduction of several bills including legislation which would help HSI fulfill its mission. The Program also secured funding for the continued development of the RAVEN analytical tools suite, the Center for Countering Human Trafficking's Blue Campaign, and the HSI National Academy for Advanced Training and Leadership.
dataset.title: HSI Significant Parterships and Outreach

dataset.description: This dataset includes information about the National Gangs and Violent Crimes Unit (NGVCU) expanding the Violent Gang Task Force (VGTF) from 7 to 18 offices. In FY 2024, HSI Transnational gang investigations resulted in 4,523 criminal arrests, 2,189 indictments and 1,106 convictions.
dataset.title: National Gangs and Violent Crimes Unit

dataset.description: This dataset includes information about the Document Benefit Fraud Task Forces (DBFTFs), which HSI operates across the country to deter, disrupt, and dismantle TCOs involved in identiy and benefit fraud.
dataset.title: Document Benefit Fraud Task Forces

dataset.description: This dataset details HSI's partnership with the Office of Foreign Asset Control (OFAC) to better incorporate HSI investigative findings into OFAC sanction determinations.
dataset.title: HSI and the Department of Treasury's Office of Foreign Asset Control Partnership

dataset.description: This dataset includes key details about HSI supporting the U.S. Secret Service with multiple national special security events (NSSE). A key event in 2024 was Super Bowl 58, where HSI supported state, local, and federal partners to seize counterfiet goods, made felony arrests, and identified and assisted victims of human trafficking.
dataset.title: National Special Security Events

dataset.description: This Dataset identifies the FY 2024 six operational priorities designated by HSI based on law enforcement trends, ways the workforce must evolve to face emerging threats, and congressional mandates. The six priorities are: 1) Financial Crimes; 2) Cybercrimes; 3) National security; 4) Opioids and precursors; 5) Crimes of human exploitation and victimization; 6) Global trade.
dataset.title: FY 2024 HSI Priorities

dataset.description: This dataset includes information about HSI's Cross-Border Financial Crime Center (CBFCC), which strengthens the United STates' anti-money laundering framework. The CBFCC is a public-private partnership aimed at convening federal law enforcement agencies, partner nations, financial institutions and financial technology companies collaborate to fight cross-border financial crime.
dataset.title: Cross-Border Financial Crime Center

dataset.description: This dataset details information about HSI's Third-Party Money Laundering (3PML) program, which targets those responsible for laundering criminal proceeds for TCOs all over the world. In FY 2024, 3PML investigations yielded 152 arrests, 121 indictments, 17 convictions, and 314 seizures totaling $102,997,681.
dataset.title: Third-Party Money Laundering

dataset.description: This dataset details information about HSI's Asset Forfeiture Unit (AFU). The AFU is the primary liaison to the Department of the Treasury's Executive Office for Asset Forfeiture and the Treasury Forfeiture Fund. HSI uses asset forfeitures to disrupt and dismantle TCOs.
dataset.title: Asset Forfeiture

dataset.description: This dataset includes infomration about how HSI willl continue to leverage its unique investigative authorities to investigate financial fraud schemes.
dataset.title: Financial Fraud

dataset.description: This data set includes details about the HSI Cyber Crimes Center being redesignated as the DHS Cyber Crimes Center (C3). The redesignation aimed to enhance coordination and cooperation across DHS so that there is a coordinated, DHS-wide approach.
dataset.title: DHS Cyber Crimes Center

dataset.description: This dataset details a two-week operation called Operation Renewed Hope II, which was led by C3's Child Exploitation Investigations Unit's Victim Identification Lab. The operation focused on reviewing CSEA case materials depicting unidentified victims from around the world to identify and assist victims.
dataset.title: Operation Renewed Hope II

dataset.description: This dataset conatins information about Operation Cyber Centurion (OCC), which disrupts hundreds of cyber intrusion and ransomware attacks that target critical infrastructure, such as major utilities, healthcare, public education, financial systems, emergency services and local government operations.
dataset.title: Operation Cyber Centurion

dataset.description: This dataset details The Human Rights Violators and War Crimes Center (HRVWCC), which identifies, prosecutes and removes individuals who committed human rights violations and war crimes prior to entering the United States.
dataset.title: Human Rights Violators and War Crimes Center

dataset.description: This dataset provides details about the Special Interest Investigations Unit (SIIU), which identifies and combats national security threats by aggregating, analyzing, and delivering intelligence and counterintelligence support to internal and external stakeholders
dataset.title: Special Interest Investigations

dataset.description: This dataset includes information on how the Counter Threat Lead Development Unit (CTLD) identifies and disrupts state and non-state actors and dismantles transnational criminal enterprises and organizations that threaten the security of the United States through the xploitation of the nation's immigration system.
dataset.title: Counter Threat Lead Development

dataset.description: This datset includes information about how Operation Citadel focuses HSI authorities and subject matter expertise on priority TCOs involved in human smuggling, human trafficking, firearms trafficking, bulk cash smuggling, narcotics smuggling and other criminal activities in Latin America.
dataset.title: Operation Citadel

dataset.description: This dataset conatins information about the Visa Security Program (VSP), which is an HSI-led counterterrorism program that assigns HSI special agents to diplomatic posts worldwide to conduct law enforcement visa-security activities and train the Department of State's Bureau of Consular Affairs on threats, trends and other topics affecting visa adjudsication. VSP is key tool HSI deployed internationally to prevent terrorists and other national security threats from obtaining visas and travelling to the United States.
dataset.title: Visa Security Program

dataset.description: This datset details how HSI's Strategy for Combating Illicit Opioids leverages HSI's experience and unique investigative authorities for combating TCOs. HSI aims to reduce the harm illicit opioids have on U.S. communities. rnrnOperation ORION aligns with the goals and strategies set forth in the Strategy for Combating Illicit Opioids. In FY 2024, HSI increased the number of Border Enforcement Security Task Forces (BESTs), Fentanyl Abatement and Suppression Teams (FASTs), and Fentanyl Overdose Resolution Teams (FORTs) and placed them in strategic locations to support HSI's nationwide fentanyl and fentanyl-related substance supply reduction strategy.
dataset.title: Strategy for Combating Illicit Opioids and Operation ORION

dataset.description: This dataset details how HSI’s Document Benefit & Labor Exploitation Unit (DBLEU) plays a critical role in maintaining the integrity of the employment and labor standards in the United States. HSI uses a victim-centered approach to dismantle the infrastructure that exploits vulnerable populations, such as fraudulent document mills and smuggling and money laundering organizations.
dataset.title: Document Benefit and Labor Exploitation

dataset.description: This dataset provides details how HSI’s Global Trade Division oversees and supports investigations of U.S. import and export laws related to trade fraud and counter-proliferation, including operation of the National Intellectual Property Rights Coordination Center, the Export Enforcement Coordination Center and the Counterproliferation Mission Center.
dataset.title: Global Trade Investigations

dataset.description: This dataset details how the National Intellectual Property Rights Coordination Center (IPR Center) has led the government's response to combating global intellectual property theft and enforcing intellectual property rights violations. The IPR Center plays a significant role in policing the sale and distribution of counterfeit goods on websites, social media, and the dark web.
dataset.title: National Intellectual Property Rights Coordination Center

dataset.description: This dataset details the launch of Headquarters Trade Enforcement Coordination Center (TECC) at the IPR Center to support HSI field office TECCs around the country. TECCs integrate HSI and CBP personnel and resources to identify instances of international trade fraud and enhance trade enforcement by promoting interagency collaboration, information sharing and efficient communication.
dataset.title: Headquarters Trade Enforcement Coordination Center

dataset.description: This dataset provides details of how HSI established the Government Supply Chain Investigations Unit (GSCIU) in response to growing concerns over the infiltration of counterfeit and substandard goods into the U.S. government supply chain. The GSCIU focuses on three critical missions: Protecting national security, ensuring military readiness, and assuring veteran and warfighter safety.The GSCIU operates in a task force environment, which allows for the integration and analysis of interagency information and enhances the collective ability to identify and combat threats to the U.S. government supply chain.
dataset.title: Government Supply Chain Investigations Unit

dataset.description: This dataset provides details HSI’s Counter-Proliferation Investigations (CPI) program, which is the agency’s lead for export enforcement. CPI’s primary mission is to prevent illicit procurement networks, terrorist groups and hostile nations from illegally obtaining U.S. military products, sensitive dual-use technology and weapons of mass destruction. Additionally, CPI provides investigative and analytical support to HSI special agents who conduct counter-proliferation investigations.
dataset.title: Counter-Proliferation Investigations

dataset.description: This dataset provides details about Operation Cold Steel, which is an international operation targeting the illicit movement of weapons into Canada over the U.S. Northern Border.
dataset.title: Operation Cold Steel

dataset.description: This dataset provides information about how HSI has been targeting the illicit sale and shipment of petroleum products that originated in Iran in violation of U.S. sanctions for the benefit of the Iranian Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps-Quds Force (IRGC).
dataset.title: Targeting of Illicit Iranian Origin Petroleum Products

dataset.description: This dataset provides details about The Export Enforcement Coordination Center (E2C2), which is the primary forum within the federal government where executive departments and agencies coordinate and enhance export enforcement efforts. E2C2 has collaborative partnerships with 25 federal agencies across DHS, the Office of the Director of National Intelligence, and the Departments of Justice, Commerce, State, Energy, Treasury and Defense.
dataset.title: Export Enforcement Coordination Center

dataset.description: This dataset provides information about the Counterproliferation Mission Center (CPMC) in Huntsville, Alabama, which serves as HSI’s focal point for enhancing counterproliferation investigations for HSI domestic and international offices. As part of its analytical support, CPMC uses innovative analytical tools to increase the speed and efficiency through which investigators can analyze large amounts of data for pertinent evidence.
dataset.title: Counterproliferation Mission Center

dataset.description: This dataset provides key details about HSI weapons seizures. The dataset also contains details about a training event for a delegation representing seven nations from the Caribbean Community National Gun Intelligence Unit that CPI personnel hosted. The training also included discussions on the current state and trends of firearms smuggling in the Caribbean region, with participants agreeing to strengthen ongoing collaboration in addressing this issue.
dataset.title: Weapons Seizures

dataset.description: This dataset includes details about the accomplishments of the Cultural Property, Arts and Antiquities (CPAA) program, which includes repatriating approximately 1,850 artifacts and pieces of cultural property, CPAA's participation in the first cultural property training program at the International Law Enforcement Academy (ILEA) in El Salvador, and CPAA's collaboration with domestic partners to deliver two all-day webinars on Cultural Property of Native American and Indigenous People and Paleontological Resources and Fossils.
dataset.title: Cultural Property, Arts and Antiquities Program

dataset.description: This dataset includes the Mission and Organization of the Office of the Principal Legal Advisor. The ICE Office of the Principal Legal Advisor (OPLA) protects the homeland by diligently litigating cases and adhering to the highest standards of professional conduct; providing essential, timely and accurate legal advice and counsel to agency leadership and personnel on cutting-edge matters; and optimizing resources to advance the DHS and ICE missions.
dataset.title: Office of the Principal Legal Advisor

dataset.description: This dataset includes details about OPLA's management of Immigration Cases. Among the broad range of legal issues OPLA handles, immigration cases are among the most critical. OPLA attorneys are the exclusive DHS representatives in administrative immigration removal proceedings before the DOJ’s Executive Office for Immigration Review (EOIR), including immigration courts and the Board of Immigration Appeals (BIA).
dataset.title: Immigration Case Management

dataset.description: This dataset details how OPLA works hand in hand with HSI agents and ERO officers to ensure that individuals who have committed serious crimes before entering the country are identified and prosecuted or removed from the country, as approp.
dataset.title: Significant Immigration Case Litigation

dataset.description: This datset is about how in FY 2024, OPLA, in coordination with EOIR, implemented nationwide guidance for handling juvenile matters to ensure due process in immigration proceedings and maximize opportunities for juveniles appearing in immigration courts to access outside legal advice and counsel. This cross-agency initiative supports DHS’s commitment to the compassionate handling of such cases and helps combat human trafficking, child labor and exploitation.
dataset.title: Specialized Juvenile Docket

dataset.description: This dataset details some of the challenges the OPLA attorneys faced in FY 2024 due to an unprecedented uptick in federal litigation, providing legal representation and guidance to the agency and assisting DOJ before federal courts in matters ranging from immigration law, customs law, criminal law, administrative law, tort law, employment law and fiscal law.
dataset.title: Federal and Administrative Litigation

dataset.description: This dataset provides details about the Special Assistant U.S. Attorney Program (SAUSA). Despite overall staffing shortages throughout the fiscal year, OPLA expanded number of full-time SAUSA participants on detail to the DOJ, where its attorneys prosecute criminal immigration and customs violations in federal courts.
dataset.title: Special Assistant U.S. Attorney Program

dataset.description: This dataset details some of the complex and high-profile cases that OPLA was involved in throughout FY 2024.
dataset.title: Complex Federal District Court Matters

dataset.description: This dataset provides detais about how OPLA also represents the agency and supports litigation efforts by the DOJ in federal matters before various administrative tribunals.
dataset.title: Civil and Administrative Litigation

dataset.description: This dataset provides details about how OPLA also plays a critical role in ensuring the agency adheres to the highest ethical standards, advising ICE and its workforce on professional conduct, as well as fiscal, contractual and employment matters. Additionally, OPLA also helped safeguard the integrity and quality of the procurement process by seeking suspensions and debarments for entities engaged in criminal or other improper conduct, barring those entities from doing business with the government, and recouping lost funds.
dataset.title: Administrative and General Law Advice and Counsel

dataset.description: This dataset details how OPLA helps uphold ICE’s mission and supports the workforce is through its robust training program.
dataset.title: Training Clients and Engaging Stakeholders

dataset.description: This dataset details the challenges that OPLA has had as a relatively small agency with a complex mission and growing workload and finite resources. Since 2018, the growth of OPLA’s workforce has lagged compared to EOIR’s rapidly expanding immigration court system, and this widening gap has contributed to case backlogs, staff burnout and resources drained from other initiatives.
dataset.title: Addressing Staffing Challenges

dataset.description: This dataset details the Enterprise Transformation Initiative (ETI). ETI is an agencywide, strategic effort to modernize and enhance ICE's enterprise service capabilities — the administrative support capabilities, such as hiring, facilities management, career and leadership development, and budget planning and execution, — that ensure ICE can meet its mission of protecting public safety and national security.
dataset.title: Enterprise Transformation Initiative

dataset.description: This dataset details how the ICE Office of Human Capital (OHC) activated the Government and Retirement Benefits (GRB) Platform for all ICE employees, replacing the functions previously utilized in FedHR Navigator. The new online platform offers improvements to both the human resources and customer experiences by providing an intuitive and innovative interface for employees to submit certain retirement and benefit-related requests.
dataset.title: Government and Retirement Benefits Platform

dataset.description: This dataset details ICE's participation in the DHS EXPO Hiring event and the Direct-Hire Authority Delegation that OHC received for several mission critical occupations in support of geopolitical and evolving global economic events critical to ensuring national security and public safety in accordance with presidential executive orders.
dataset.title: Recruitment and Hiring

dataset.description: This dataset details some key achievements that the Office of Leadership and Career Development had in FY 2024.
dataset.title: The Office of Leadership and Career Development

dataset.description: This dataset provides details about ICE’s Data Modernization Strategy, which provides ongoing guidelines to encourage data that is secure, connected, accessible and reliable.
dataset.title: ICE Data Modernization

dataset.description: This dataset details how ICE recognizes the transformative potential of artificial intelligence (AI) to the mission space. the agency continued to establish the foundation for the safe, secure and ethical development and use of AI technology.
dataset.title: Artificial Intelligence

dataset.description: This dataset details how ICE’s Fleet Management Program completed the upfitting, evaluation and delivery of two electric vehicles (EVs).
dataset.title: Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Planning

dataset.description: This dataset details how the ICE Office of Acquisition Management (OAQ) continued to support ICE’s Vendor Engagement Events Program with three separate ICE program-focused events.
dataset.title: Effectively Addressing ICE’s Fiscal and Procurement Responsibilities

dataset.description: This dataset details how ICE continued to build off its FY 2023 accomplishments to mature its Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) program as required by OMB Circular No. A-123.
dataset.title: Enterprise Risk Management

dataset.description: This dataset includes the Mission and Organization of the Office of the Chief Financial Officer
dataset.title: OFCO Mission and Organization

dataset.description: This dataset details how OCFO effectively executed the largest budget in ICE’s history, obligating 99.88% of ICE’s FY 2024 funding with a 0.12% lapse, a 0.05% reduction from the previous year.
dataset.title: Budget Execution

dataset.description: This dataset details how ODA continued to develop an enhanced Detention Bed Model and conducted preliminary analyses on transportation, ATD, and medical models to forecast budgetary needs based on various factors, such as inflation and bed utilization rate
dataset.title: Cost Analysis

dataset.description: This dataset details how the Security Program Office (SEC) safeguards people, information and facilities through comprehensive and integrated programs that encompass threat management, as well as personnel, physical, information and administrative security.
dataset.title: Security Program Office

dataset.description: This dataset details how the Inspections Program Office (ISP) inspects, audits and reviews ICE directorates, programs and detention standards to assess compliance with federal laws and applicable policies and procedures. This internal oversight provides ICE leadership with an independent and objective review of the performance and organizational health of ICE offices and programs
dataset.title: Inspections Program Office

dataset.description: This dataset details how the Investigations Program Office (INV) manages and investigates allegations of employee misconduct and oversees a variety of other integrity programs. This oversight protects public trust and preserves the highest standards of integrity and accountability across the agency.
dataset.title: Investigations Program Office

dataset.description: This dataset includes the Mission and Organization of the ICE Office of Diversity and Civil Rights (ODCR). ODCR is responsible for directing and integrating the application of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended, as well as other applicable non-discrimination complaint systems and affirmative employment programs. The mission of ODCR is to ensure that the rights of employees and applicants are protected, and that the agency promotes a proactive equal employment opportunity program to achieve an ethnically diverse workplace.
dataset.title: Office of Diversity and Civil Rights Mission and Organization

dataset.description: This dataset details how the Civil Liberties Division (CLD) continued its work to promote equitable access to ICE’s programs, services and activities across its main mission areas of compliance, language access and disability access.
dataset.title: Civil Liberties Division

dataset.description: Thid dataset details how the Diversity Management Division (DMD) is responsible for providing applicants, employees and management with the necessary tools and available resources to address the needs of a diverse workforce.
dataset.title: Diversity Management Division

dataset.description: This dataset details how the Complaints and Resolution Division (CRD) was challenged by the departure of several key staff members, including its deputy division chief.
dataset.title: Complaints and Resolution Division

dataset.description: This dataset includes the Mission and Organization of the Office of External Affairs. ICE established the ICE Office of External Affairs (OEA) in January 2024 to streamline public communications and ensure more transparent, factual communication and information sharing that represents the agency’s core values.
dataset.title: Office of External Affairs Mission and Organization

dataset.description: This dataset includes the Mission and Organization of the Office of Partnership and Engagement. The ICE Office of Partnership and Engagement (OPE) coordinates outreach efforts with the public, key stakeholders and leadership from HSI, ERO and OPLA to increase local and national awareness of ICE’s mission while building relationships and fostering trust in U.S. communities.
dataset.title: Office of Partnership and Engagement

dataset.description: This dataset includes the Mission and Organization of the Office of Firearms and Tactical Programs. The ICE Office of Firearms and Tactical Programs (OFTP) is responsible for all use of force policy, training and equipment. OFTP provides specialized firearms and tactical training and certification; all equipment, support and guidance necessary to promote officer and public safety; and effective execution of ICE’s law enforcement mission.
dataset.title: Office of Firearms and Tactical Programs (OFTP) Mission and Organization

dataset.description: This dataset details how OFTP worked diligently to identify best practices and streamline common processes across the organization following the completion of the ICE Directive 19010.2: Body Worn Camera.
dataset.title: Body Worn Camera Program

dataset.description: This dataset details how OFTP developed an acquisition strategy to establish a long-term contract to meet ICE leadership’s four-year goal to transition the armed workforce to body armor with enhanced protection from recently identified ricochet hazards most associated with female body shapes.
dataset.title: Body Armor Acquisition

dataset.description: This dataset details how OFTP conducted two multimillion-dollar strategic solicitations for duty and training ammunition contracts, along with successfully awarding other high-dollar sole-source specialty ammunition contracts for duty and training purposes, which will benefit ICE and other DHS agencies.
dataset.title: Ammunition Contract Awards

dataset.description: This dataset details how in FY 2024 OFTP trained and certified 432 HSI personnel and 1,115 ERO personnel, for a combined total of 107 weeks’ worth of use of force and tactics training. Additionally, OFTP delivered the inaugural ERO Rapid Response Program course.
dataset.title: Use of Force and Tactics Training

dataset.description: This dataset details how OFTP continued to build and improve upon facilities, buildings and land acquired from the U.S. Army on Fort Moore in Georgia. The projects included developing 66 acres of space for the newly designed Advanced Training and Operations Center and several facilities supporting armory storage and the ICE BWC program.
dataset.title: Facilities Acquisition

dataset.description: This dataset details how OFTP maintained programmatic oversight of all ICE’s tactical programs, including the Crisis Negotiation Program (CNP), Tactical Emergency Medical Services (TEMS), Rapid Response Program (RRP), Special Response Team (SRT), and their sub-competencies.
dataset.title: ICE Tactical Programs Oversight

dataset.description: The data set contains multi-use, reusable, and shareable content included in NDEMU courses.  The content in the data set includes text, images, video, audio, documents.
dataset.title: NDEMU Course Content

dataset.description: Records used to verify employment eligibility through the I-9 form and any supporting documentation.
dataset.title: Employment Eligibility Verification Records

dataset.description: Records used to verify employment eligibility through the I-9 form and any supporting documentation.
dataset.title: Employment Eligibility Verification Records

dataset.description: A list of business and Federal Information Security Modernization Act (FISMA) systems at FEMA. This list is presently found on the Data Management Support sharepoint page, maintained by the Data Enablement Branch (DEB). This system list is derived from information gathered from the DHS Mobius application.

publisher.name: FEMA/Office of Policy and Program Analysis/Enterprise Analytics Division

dataset.title: FEMA System List

dataset.description: A reference list for the organization codes used at FEMA. These values are based on the USDA Table Management System (TMGT) Table 005, the Agency Organizational Structure. FEMA presently uses upwards of eight layers of divisions, teams, units, and other segementation of programs and personnel across workstreams.

publisher.name: FEMA/Office of Policy and Program Analysis/Enterprise Analytics Division

dataset.title: FEMA Organization Codes

dataset.description: Stores different fee scenarios to calculate payments for non-ELIS forms. (Permanent)
dataset.title: myUSCIS - fee-calculator
